intro: Mauria denticulata, commonly known as the toothed mallow, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its hairy, lance-shaped leaves with distinctive toothed margins. The plant produces showy, pale pink to lavender flowers that bloom in summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for both horticultural and ecological studies.
